ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Task name
Trial number
Trial type
The averaged absolute angular degree of response error for set size 1 trials
The averaged absolute angular degree of response error for set size 5 trials
The estimate of the proportion of trials that were ''in memory'' for set size 1 trials
The estimate of the proportion of trials that were ''in memory'' for set size 5 trials
The estimate of the precision of memory for ''in memory'' trials for set size 1
The estimate of the precision of memory for ''in memory'' trials for set size 5
The estimate of the angular degree separation of the two bars that is required for a participant to have a 80.35% discrimination accuracy
The proportion of errors on catch trials
Notes: This value multiplied by 2 would be the estimate of lapse rate since at-chance responding on this task would be 50%

ElementDescription: The averaged absolute angular degree of response error
The estimate of the proportion of trials that were ''in memory''
The estimate of the precision of memory for ''in memory'' trials
Proportion of correct responses across blocks with a set size of 2
Proportion of correct responses across blocks with a set size of 3
Proportion of correct responses across blocks with a set size of 4
Proportion of correct responses across blocks with a set size of 5
